context:
Thank you for your interest in applying to be a part of the Tiny House Empowerment Village community!
Since the Coordinated Entry system recently went through a major change, our funders now require that we nolonger take community referrals and instead only accept referrals through Coordinated Entry. Due to this, we willno longer be keeping our own waitlist. The only people who are now eligible are those that qualify to takeCoordinated Entry’s Crisis Assessment.
In order to be considered for a spot at the Tiny House Empowerment Village, you’ll need to either drop in or calla Housing Resource Center (options listed below), and ask if you qualify to take a Crisis Assessment (make sure tomention that you want to be referred to the Tiny House Empowerment Village shelter). If you are able to take aCrisis Assessment, and you meet the baseline eligibility requirements for our program, you’ll be placed on awaitlist that is ranked by level of need rather than order in which people apply. When we have any openings, wewill be sent referrals directly from Coordinated Entry for people ranking at the top of that list. If we receive areferral for you, we will reach out to you to ask you more questions, and to schedule an interview to see if youwould be a good fit for our program.
You can see if you qualify to take a Crisis Assessment by following one of the options listed below:

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at alex@youthspiritartworks.org.
Take care,The Tiny House Empowerment Village Team
questions:
1. What is the process for applying to the Tiny House Empowerment Village?
2. What is the process for qualifying for the Tiny House Empowerment Village?
3. What are the eligibility requirements for the Tiny House Empowerment Village?
4. How long is the waitlist for the Tiny House Empowerment Village?
5. How often do openings become available at the Tiny House Empowerment Village?
answers:
1. The process for applying to the Tiny House Empowerment Village is to first call or go in person to one of the Housing Resource Centers and ask if you qualify to take a Crisis Assessment. If you qualify, you will be placed on a waitlist that is ranked by level of need.
2. The process for qualifying for the Tiny House Empowerment Village is to take a Crisis Assessment. If you meet the baseline eligibility requirements for the program, you will be placed on a waitlist that is ranked by level of need.
3. The eligibility requirements for the Tiny House Empowerment Village are that you are homeless and have a disabling condition.
4. The waitlist for the Tiny House Empowerment Village is ranked by level of need.
5. Openings at the Tiny House Empowerment Village become available as referrals are sent from Coordinated Entry.
